fields.headline: Wimbledon women champions honoured
fields.bodyText: Five former women champions were honoured at Wimbledon yesterday. Steffi Graf, Martina Navratilova and Billie Jean King were all presented with engraved bowls by the Duchess of Gloucester to mark their achievements. Also honoured were Brazilian Maria Bueno, who won three Wimbledon and four US titles between 1959 and 1966, and Margaret Court, from Australia, who became the most successful player of all, with 62 Grand Slam titles. The former champions watched Graf's husband, Andre Agassi, play twice French Open champion Rafael Nadal, of Spain. Agassi, who collected his first Grand Slam title at SW19 in 1992, recently announced his retirement.
